div.div: At-Home learning to continue through the end of the 2019-2020 school year. Please visit www.killeenisd.org/covid19 for more information.

h1.style: background: rgb(238, 238, 238); border: 1px solid rgb(204, 204, 204); padding: 5px 10px;

img.alt: Grab and Go Meals for all children, free breakfast and lunch, click here for times and locations
all kisd staff will continued to be paid, click here for more information

em.span: Killeen ISD continues to closely monitor the spread of Coronavirus COVID-19. KISD is also in continuous communication with the Bell County Health District, the CDC, and officials at Fort Hood to coordinate our efforts. We have created this webpage to continue to provide updates to our KISD Community as information becomes available.​

hr.p: 04/21/2020 - 7:10 p.m.: Pick Up of Student Possessions Plan: We are working on plans to distribute personal possessions from classrooms and lockers once Shelter In Place Orders are lifted to allow entry into buildings. Please watch for communication from your campus in mid-May with more information. We will also work to distribute items ordered during this time.

p.br:
04/17/2020 - 12:30 p.m.: KISD Parents, As we prepare to conclude the fifth week of continued learning at home, we would like to express our appreciation for your flexibility and support during the COVID-19 closure.
Unfortunately, the challenges associated with returning to classes this semester, while ensuring the health and safety of our entire community remain evident. The circumstances involving the COVID-19 situation have dictated the need for our students and staff to continue using the established online Continued Learning Center (CLC) and mailed Elementary packets through the month of May.

04/10/2020 - 10:45 a.m.: Killeen ISD will provide Elementary students with additional Math & Literacy lessons by our KISD teachers on TV. Teachers (PK-5) will provide a 30-minute lesson on Monday/Tuesday and then circle back to close the week’s learning on Thursday/Friday. Classroom Teachers will continue communicating directly with families and students with specific information regarding their classes and lessons for students. These videos will follow the curriculum provided online in the Continue Learning Center and printed packets. The TV lessons are intended to provide additional support.
